One day, Finley was swimming through the city when he noticed a strange, tall structure that he had never seen before.
As he approached the structure, he realized that it was a tree with branches that extended into the water.
Finley was curious and decided to climb the tree to get a better view of the city.
To his surprise, he discovered that the tree had a network of roots that connected it to the underwater city.
Finley realized that the tree was not only a source of food but also a means of communication between the marine life and the city.
